verses.text_plain: For the law having a shadow of good things to come, and not the very image of the things, can never with those sacrifices which they offered year by year continually make the comers thereunto perfect.
verses.verse_html: 1For the law having a shadow of good things to come, and not the very image of the things, can never with those sacrifices which they offered year by year continually make the comers thereunto perfect.

tokens.strong_raw: G1519 G3588 G1336 lemma.TR:εις lemma.TR:το lemma.TR:διηνεκες

verses.text_plain: For then would they not have ceased to be offered? because that the worshippers once purged should have had no more conscience of sins.
verses.verse_html: 2For then would they not have ceased to be offered? because that the worshippers once purged should have had no more conscience of sins.

verses.text_plain: But in those sacrifices there is a remembrance again made of sins every year.
verses.verse_html: 3But in those sacrifices there is a remembrance again made of sins every year.

verses.text_plain: For it is not possible that the blood of bulls and of goats should take away sins.
verses.verse_html: 4For it is not possible that the blood of bulls and of goats should take away sins.

verses.text_plain: Wherefore when he cometh into the world, he saith, Sacrifice and offering thou wouldest not, but a body hast thou prepared me:
verses.verse_html: 5Wherefore when he cometh into the world, he saith, Sacrifice and offering thou wouldest not, but a body hast thou prepared me:

verses.text_plain: In burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin thou hast had no pleasure.
verses.verse_html: 6In burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin thou hast had no pleasure.

verses.text_plain: Then said I, Lo, I come (in the volume of the book it is written of me,) to do thy will, O God.
verses.verse_html: 7Then said I, Lo, I come (in the volume of the book it is written of me,) to do thy will, O God.

verses.text_plain: Above when he said, Sacrifice and offering and burnt offerings and offering for sin thou wouldest not, neither hadst pleasure therein; which are offered by the law;
verses.verse_html: 8Above when he said, Sacrifice and offering and burnt offerings and offering for sin thou wouldest not, neither hadst pleasure therein; which are offered by the law;

verses.text_plain: Then said he, Lo, I come to do thy will, O God. He taketh away the first, that he may establish the second.
verses.verse_html: 9Then said he, Lo, I come to do thy will, O God. He taketh away the first, that he may establish the second.

verses.text_plain: By the which will we are sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.
verses.verse_html: 10By the which will we are sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.

verses.text_plain: And every priest standeth daily ministering and offering oftentimes the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins:
verses.verse_html: 11And every priest standeth daily ministering and offering oftentimes the same sacrifices, which can never take away sins:

verses.text_plain: But this man, after he had offered one sacrifice for sins for ever, sat down on the right hand of God;
verses.verse_html: 12But this man, after he had offered one sacrifice for sins for ever, sat down on the right hand of God;

verses.text_plain: From henceforth expecting till his enemies be made his footstool.
verses.verse_html: 13From henceforth expecting till his enemies be made his footstool.

verses.text_plain: For by one offering he hath perfected for ever them that are sanctified.
verses.verse_html: 14For by one offering he hath perfected for ever them that are sanctified.

verses.text_plain: Whereof the Holy Ghost also is a witness to us: for after that he had said before,
verses.verse_html: 15Whereof the Holy Ghost also is a witness to us: for after that he had said before,

verses.text_plain: This is the covenant that I will make with them after those days, saith the Lord, I will put my laws into their hearts, and in their minds will I write them;
verses.verse_html: 16This is the covenant that I will make with them after those days, saith the Lord, I will put my laws into their hearts, and in their minds will I write them;

verses.text_plain: And their sins and iniquities will I remember no more.
verses.verse_html: 17And their sins and iniquities will I remember no more.

verses.text_plain: Now where remission of these is, there is no more offering for sin.
verses.verse_html: 18Now where remission of these is, there is no more offering for sin.

verses.text_plain: Having therefore, brethren, boldness to enter into the holiest by the blood of Jesus,
verses.verse_html: 19Having therefore, brethren, boldness to enter into the holiest by the blood of Jesus,

verses.text_plain: By a new and living way, which he hath consecrated for us, through the veil, that is to say, his flesh;
verses.verse_html: 20By a new and living way, which he hath consecrated for us, through the veil, that is to say, his flesh;

verses.text_plain: And having an high priest over the house of God;
verses.verse_html: 21And having an high priest over the house of God;

verses.text_plain: Let us draw near with a true heart in full assurance of faith, having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience, and our bodies washed with pure water.
verses.verse_html: 22Let us draw near with a true heart in full assurance of faith, having our hearts sprinkled from an evil conscience, and our bodies washed with pure water.

verses.text_plain: Let us hold fast the profession of our faith without wavering; (for he is faithful that promised;)
verses.verse_html: 23Let us hold fast the profession of our faith without wavering; (for he is faithful that promised;)

verses.text_plain: And let us consider one another to provoke unto love and to good works:
verses.verse_html: 24And let us consider one another to provoke unto love and to good works:

verses.text_plain: Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the manner of some is; but exhorting one another: and so much the more, as ye see the day approaching.
verses.verse_html: 25Not forsaking the assembling of ourselves together, as the manner of some is; but exhorting one another: and so much the more, as ye see the day approaching.

verses.text_plain: For if we sin wilfully after that we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remaineth no more sacrifice for sins,
verses.verse_html: 26For if we sin wilfully after that we have received the knowledge of the truth, there remaineth no more sacrifice for sins,

verses.text_plain: But a certain fearful looking for of judgment and fiery indignation, which shall devour the adversaries.
verses.verse_html: 27But a certain fearful looking for of judgment and fiery indignation, which shall devour the adversaries.

verses.text_plain: He that despised Moses’ law died without mercy under two or three witnesses:
verses.verse_html: 28He that despised Moses’ law died without mercy under two or three witnesses:

verses.text_plain: Of how much sorer punishment, suppose ye, shall he be thought worthy, who hath trodden under foot the Son of God, and hath counted the blood of the covenant, wherewith he was sanctified, an unholy thing, and hath done despite unto the Spirit of grace?
verses.verse_html: 29Of how much sorer punishment, suppose ye, shall he be thought worthy, who hath trodden under foot the Son of God, and hath counted the blood of the covenant, wherewith he was sanctified, an unholy thing, and hath done despite unto the Spirit of grace?

verses.text_plain: For we know him that hath said, Vengeance belongeth unto me, I will recompense, saith the Lord. And again, The Lord shall judge his people.
verses.verse_html: 30For we know him that hath said, Vengeance belongeth unto me, I will recompense, saith the Lord. And again, The Lord shall judge his people.

verses.text_plain: It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.
verses.verse_html: 31It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.

verses.text_plain: But call to remembrance the former days, in which, after ye were illuminated, ye endured a great fight of afflictions;
verses.verse_html: 32But call to remembrance the former days, in which, after ye were illuminated, ye endured a great fight of afflictions;

verses.text_plain: Partly, whilst ye were made a gazingstock both by reproaches and afflictions; and partly, whilst ye became companions of them that were so used.
verses.verse_html: 33Partly, whilst ye were made a gazingstock both by reproaches and afflictions; and partly, whilst ye became companions of them that were so used.

tokens.text: whilst ye were made a gazingstock

verses.text_plain: For ye had compassion of me in my bonds, and took joyfully the spoiling of your goods, knowing in yourselves that ye have in heaven a better and an enduring substance.
verses.verse_html: 34For ye had compassion of me in my bonds, and took joyfully the spoiling of your goods, knowing in yourselves that ye have in heaven a better and an enduring substance.

verses.text_plain: Cast not away therefore your confidence, which hath great recompence of reward.
verses.verse_html: 35Cast not away therefore your confidence, which hath great recompence of reward.

verses.text_plain: For ye have need of patience, that, after ye have done the will of God, ye might receive the promise.
verses.verse_html: 36For ye have need of patience, that, after ye have done the will of God, ye might receive the promise.

verses.text_plain: For yet a little while, and he that shall come will come, and will not tarry.
verses.verse_html: 37For yet a little while, and he that shall come will come, and will not tarry.

verses.text_plain: Now the just shall live by faith: but if any man draw back, my soul shall have no pleasure in him.
verses.verse_html: 38Now the just shall live by faith: but if any man draw back, my soul shall have no pleasure in him.

verses.text_plain: But we are not of them who draw back unto perdition; but of them that believe to the saving of the soul.
verses.verse_html: 39But we are not of them who draw back unto perdition; but of them that believe to the saving of the soul.
